newsitem.title: USA: Merck to file for 6 new drugs within 2 yrs.
newsitem.headline: Merck to file for 6 new drugs within 2 yrs.

text.p: Merck and Co Inc plans to seek regulatory clearance in the U.S. for six new drugs within two years, a company spokeswoman told Reuters.
The spokesman was commenting on the company's annual report which said that Merck plans to seek regulatory clearance for eight new drugs and 12 supplemental claims for existing Merck products.
Merck has already filed for one of those eight drugs, Propecia for male baldness, she said.
Propecia is a lower-dose form of Proscar, a Merck drug used for treating enlarged prostates.
She said that Merck has changed its time horizon for filing for another of the eight drugs. She said the company plans to file for MK-966 for arthritis and pain by the year 2000.
Merck plans to file for clearance for Copost for glaucoma, Maxalt for migraines, Singulair for asthma and Aggrastat for unstable angina within two years.
The company also plans to file for high dose and sustained release versions of its Zocor drug for elevated cholesterol.
